snippet: The government took a loss on Old Second National Bank in Illinois, but investors who bought its stake may come close to tripling their money.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column examines case of the Old Second National Bank in Aurora, Ill, one of more than 700 community banks who received a TARP bailout during financial crisis; notes that while government took loss on Old Second, investors who bought its stake have nearly tripled their money and bank is once again issuing loans, amounting to what could be called an example of successful regulation.
lead_paragraph: The government took a loss on Old Second National Bank in Illinois, but investors who bought its stake may come close to tripling their money.

headline.print_headline: Bailout Gave Small Bank a Chance to Survive
headline.main: Bailout Gave Small Bank a Chance to Survive
